item.title: Cyberpunk 2077’s Smart Weapons Have Barely Scratched the Surface
item.description:
In Cyberpunk 2077 , few offensive options are more effective than Smart Weapons. Developed with in-universe gyrojet technology, these firearms track the position of their targets, rounding corners and hitting their marks despite any potential obstacles. This can effectively trivialize enemies' use of cover, so it's no surprise that Smart Weapons are a favorite among Cyberpunk 2077 players, especially those favoring tech-focused or low-health builds.

Cyberpunk 2077 's Intelligence skill tree synergizes with Smart Weapons, so those speccing into such perks are further incentivized to use this weapon class.

But as useful as Smart Weapons often are, they're also a bit boring. Sure, it's fun to run and gun without having to worry about aiming, and to dispatch an encounter's more annoying enemies—those that choose to never leave cover—but it can also undermine the difficulty of Cyberpunk 2077 's combat. Theoretically, players using Smart Weapons can just camp behind cover themselves; they encourage a passive playstyle. Smart Weapons also aren't quite as versatile as they first seem, since their low bullet velocity and damage output relative to other guns actually make them inferior in straightforward firefights. By getting a bit more creative with their implementation into the RPG framework, and by digging deeper into Cyberpunk lore, Project Orion could build upon Smart Weapons' foundations in interesting ways.

How Project Orion Can Elevate Cyberpunk 2077's Version of Smart Weapons

Folding Greater Complexity Into Project Orion's Smart Weapon Arsenal

Put simply, the only real advantage or point-of-difference Smart Weapons have to offer is their enemy-tracking capabilities. The weapon class's features would need to be expanded to keep them interesting in Project Orion , and something as small as adding one extra layer of utility could do the trick. Since they are so intrinsically linked to Cyberpunk 's far-future tech, perhaps Smart Weapons could connect to Quickhacking in the sequel: players could add a Quickhack to a given Smart Weapon, adding a chance to inflict Overheat or Contagion on enemies in a flash, without needing to sacrifice RAM.

This alone would go a long way toward deepening Smart Weapon builds. Players could simply augment their damage-dealing potential by pairing a Smart Weapon with Short Circuit, Synapse Burnout, and other combat Quickhacks, or they could lean into Control, Covert, and Ultimate Quickhacks, blinding enemies, turning them against each other, and even making them turn their own weapons on themselves. This could provide paths toward any number of overpowered, expressive, and creative combat builds.

This could also be a boon for non-lethal playthroughs. Smart Weapons could be made non-lethal through a weapon mod (kind of like Skippy's pacifist mode), or turned non-lethal by virtue of a non-lethal Quickhack like System Collapse. If Project Orion actually rewards players for playing non-lethally, or at least adds some kind of consequence for this playstyle, then Smart Weapons' utility could be expanded even further.

Project Orion's Setting Could Inform How Smart Weapons Operate

It's worth noting the possible limitations that Cyberpunk 2077 's lore could impose on Smart Weapons in the sequel. At the moment, it's not clear when Project Orion will be set: it could be a prequel to Cyberpunk 2077 , it could be set directly after the events of the game, or it could take place even further in the future. Smart Weapons were invented in the 1960s, per Cyberpunk 's lore, so they would likely appear regardless of when Project Orion is set, though a pre-2077 setting would likely restrict Smart Weapon development.

However, if Project Orion were to be set several years after Cyberpunk 2077 , it's conceivable that it could feature advancements in Smart Weapon technology. This could provide the narrative justification needed to get more ambitious with the weapon class, as in-universe firearms manufacturers may have become even more enthusiastic and inventive with their tools of violence.

119
9.0 /10
6 /10

item.title: Rumor: Elder Scrolls 6 Release Window Narrowed Down by Leaker
item.description:
A leaker has recently hinted that The Elder Scrolls 6 could be aiming for a late 2027 release. This could be disappointing news for fans wanting to play The Elder Scrolls 6 , as it means that the game could be a long way from being released, and some gamers still have some hopes that it will be out next year.

The Elder Scrolls 6 was announced with a trailer back in 2018, and not much has been shared about it since then. While TES 6 reportedly entered pre-production in 2018, fully active development only started in 2023 after Starfield ’s launch, and the title is not expected to be out earlier than 2026.

Leaker Narrows Down Elder Scrolls 6's Release Window to Late 2027

Prominent leaker eXtas1s has recently claimed that Bethesda could be planning to release The Elder Scrolls 6 in late 2027 in one of his latest videos. While the release window certainly carries an element of speculation to it, eXtas1s argues that Bethesda’s team is fully committed to the development of the game and defends the possible release window. In any case, gamers should take this prediction with a grain of salt, as Bethesda has not yet confirmed a release date, which could be before or after late 2027.

This is not the first time that eXtas1s has talked about The Elder Scrolls 6 , but the famous leaker has jumped the gun on the subject recently. Back in February, for example, eXtas1s claimed that Bethesda could offer a glimpse of The Elder Scrolls 6 in July with a new trailer, which did not happen.

Previous rumors of a new The Elder Scrolls 6 trailer surfaced yet again in June, as Jez Corden reported that there was a new internal TES 6 trailer circulating within Bethesda. Corden believed that the trailer could be presented during the Xbox Games Showcase, which, again, did not happen.

Despite these failed predictions, everything points to the development of TES 6 running smoothly during 2025. The Elder Scrolls 6 has been reported to be in a playable state, an important development milestone. While this does not mean that the game is nearly in its finished state, it indicates that at least progress is being made. Hopefully, gamers will discover more about TES 6 soon, including the place where the title will be set or even the game’s full name. While there’s speculation that the game could be set in Hammerfell and Highrock, there’s simply nothing confirming this theory yet.

The Elder Scrolls 6

item.title: WWE 2K25 Shutdown Date Revealed
item.description:
Though WWE 2K25 was released just six months ago, publisher 2K Games has announced the wrestling title's server shutdown date. However, players don't have to worry about WWE 2K25 disappearing anytime soon, as the shutdown date is set precisely two years from when the game launched.

It's common knowledge by now that online-centric sports and multiplayer games have a limited shelf life owing to factors like high server upkeep costs, license expirations, changes in ownership of publishing rights, and more. Compounding this further is the shift toward digital-only games that effectively vanish into the ether after being delisted from online storefronts, an issue that the Stop Killing Games movement aims to combat. The 2K-published WWE 2K25 is the latest game for which a server shutdown date has been revealed, but players are at least being given a decent heads-up.

WWE 2K25 Servers Will Be Retired in March 2027

Not long after WWE 2K25 headlined the PS Plus Extra and Premium September 2025 lineup, it's been revealed that the wresting game will go offline starting March 14, 2027 . This information comes courtesy of 2K's Online Services Status page, and the shutdown date is exactly two full years from WWE 2K25 's launch on March 14, 2025. Players now have just under a year and a half to rack up WWE 2K25 trophies, enjoy its multiplayer modes, build wacky characters using Community Creations, and what not. Still, for a $70 game available across virtually every notable platform right now, a two-year window of relevance does feel a tad too short.

In fact, WWE 2K25 players on Switch 2 have it slightly worse than those on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC, because the game came to the Nintendo handheld in late July 2025 — over four months after the other platforms — that too at the same $70 price point. Therefore, Switch 2 players are getting a bit less value out of their purchase relative to when WWE 2K25 servers are planned to go offline. Combine that with WWE 2K25 's Switch 2 version omitting features like the image uploader and Community Creations, and the value quotient for Nintendo users sinks further.

Compared to WWE 2K23 and WWE 2K24 , WWE 2K25 is getting a mildly longer lease on life at least, with the former two games slated to go offline about 22 months from their respective release dates. Moreover, WWE 2K25 isn't the only 2K-published title that will stop receiving further support in 2027 either, with online service for PGA Tour 2K23 set to be retired on February 28, 2027 — just a couple of weeks earlier. More imminently, 2K will shut down The Golf Club 2019 and PGA Tour 2K21 on October 30, 2025.

27
8.1 /10
9 /10

item.title: How to Climb SV News Building in Skate
item.description:
The SV News building is located in Skate 's Gullcrest Village neighborhood, and challenges can appear on top of it. To start those challenges, players must climb the SV News building, though the way that is done may not be immediately obvious. This guide is intended for players who are confused about how to get onto the SV News building in Skate , and, fortunately, the process is fairly straightforward.

Players can eventually unlock a fast travel point on top of the SV News building, which will make it so that they do not need to climb the structure every time they want to take on a Skate challenge that appears there.

How to Get Onto SV News Building in Skate

Corners Are the Key

The first step towards climbing the SV News building is navigating to one of its four corners . While it is possible to start the ascent from any of the building's corners, the southern and eastern corners are the easiest to access, and their precise positions have been marked on the preceding map.

Upon arriving at one of these positions, players will see that there are three horizontal lines etched into the corner . Skate players should approach those lines, press the climb input to grab one, and then hold up on the left joystick while repeatedly pressing the climb input to ascend to the protruding ledge.

The climb input is the X button on a PlayStation controller and the A button on an Xbox controller.

Players should now hold either left or right on the left joystick to shimmy along the ledge, stopping when they are underneath a window. Players can then hold up on the left joystick and repeatedly press the climb input once again to make their way up another wall. At the top, players will encounter one more wall, which they climb by holding up on the left joystick and the climb input, and the SV News buildings' fast travel point and challenges are on top of it.

To note, players who have reached the top of the building can climb its tower by moving up the handholds that are between its windows. Some players may even want to go all the way to the top, and the preceding image highlights the handholds that they should be targeting. While players may not find any challenges at the top, there is a fast travel point there, and it is a great spot to spread eagle from.

7.0 /10

item.title: GTA 6’s Third Protagonist Theory Explained
item.description:
The wait for Grand Theft Auto 6 grows shorter every day, and as time passes, eager fans have been speculating on what Rockstar could have up its sleeve this time around. Grand Theft Auto 6 is set to be an industry-changing launch, which has made the game a massive target for fan theories and rumors. This is understandable, given the hype, and a theory suggesting that GTA 6 is hiding a third protagonist is one of the most intriguing yet.

There is still a lot of mystery surrounding GTA 6 , but it's been confirmed for a while now that the game will feature two protagonists, Jason and Lucia. This marks the first time in the franchise that a male and female duo have led a GTA story, and its Bonnie and Clyde vibes are clear. It's a fascinating step for the series, and it's also what ignited this secret third character theory in the first place.

This article contains spoilers for Red Dead Redemption and Red Dead Redemption 2 .

GTA 6's Third Protagonist Theory Explained

Jason and Lucia May Not Make it Out Alive

The theory stems from GTA 6 's Bonne and Clyde influence, as the two real-life outlaws were gunned down in a blaze of gunfire in Louisiana. If GTA 6 is really taking its Bonnie and Clyde energy to heart, then it's definitely possible that Jason and Lucia (or at least one of them) could meet the same fate. Of course, there's no way to know for sure until the game launches, and this is purely speculation, but it's not outside the realm of possibility.

GTA 6 will be released on May 26, 2026. Delays are always possible, but as of now, Rockstar appears to be on track to launch on the scheduled date.

Who Could Be the Third Playable Character?

GTA 6 's second trailer gave deeper insight into the cast beyond its dual protagonists, but one character who still remains incredibly mysterious is Raul Bautista . It would be quite compelling to have Raul Bautista as a third playable character, and although this theory feels random at first glance, it's not exactly the craziest idea, especially with Rockstar's history with Red Dead Redemption .

The epilogues of both RDR1 and RDR2 have players take on the role of a brand-new character after the deaths of the main protagonists. In RDR1 , Jack Marston closes out the story after John Marston's death, and John leads RDR2 's finale after Arthur Morgan's emotional demise.

If Jason, Lucia, or both, meet a similarly tragic end, then it's easy to imagine a scenario where Raul Bautista would close out the story in an epilogue segment in the same way that RDR1 and RDR2 did. With Bautista being one of the most secretive secondary characters confirmed for the story, it's understandable why his role is being questioned. It's important to remember that theories are far from fact, but it's definitely one of the most interesting to spring up during the wait for GTA 6 's launch.

If GTA 6 is really taking its Bonnie and Clyde energy to heart, then it's definitely possible that Jason and Lucia (or at least one of them) could meet the same fate.

Rockstar has described Raul Bautista as a charming and reckless bank robber with a lot of experience under his belt.

More GTA 6 News Hopefully Arrives Before the Year is Over

There's no telling when Rockstar will reveal more about GTA 6 . The hype has hit a fever pitch, so there is hopefully one more trailer waiting in the wings before the game is here, so fans can get an even deeper look into what to expect. Only time will tell if Raul Bautista turns out to be a secret playable character, but regardless, it will be exciting to finally learn more about him.

Grand Theft Auto 6
